snippet: After Sunday’s elections in breakaway regions of Ukraine, Western officials are increasingly concerned that the Kremlin may be trying to establish an enclave outside Kiev’s control.
abstract: NATO says hundreds of Russian troops are still training and equipping separatists in Ukraine; activities are heightening tensions with the West and Ukraine's government that were aggravated by elections in breakaway regions of eastern Ukraine.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ANDREW E. KRAMER
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Washington, and Andrew E. Kramer from Donetsk, Ukraine.

lead_paragraph: After Sunday’s elections in breakaway regions of Ukraine, Western officials are increasingly concerned that the Kremlin may be trying to establish an enclave outside Kiev’s control.

headline.main: Russia Continues to Train and Equip Ukraine Rebels, NATO Official Says
headline.print_headline: Russia Continues to Train and Equip Ukraine Rebels, NATO Official Says
